Gramium

• Entire Team

Inspiration

Gramium is trying to help rural people to develop skills and get loan for their small business. NGO help to get small loan to this rural people and also become guaranteer for their loan. As there are so many people are getting help from Gramium, It is hard for Gramium to keep track of all portfolios on traditional notebook and Excel sheets. There are two main problem. Because of their traditional operations methodology, they are not able to scale much. and second is, they are facing financial issues because of loan defaulters who fails often to pay loan instalments on time.

What it does

Our system notifies the loan taker about load loan payment dues and deadline.

How we built it

We used Twilio and django .

Challenges we ran into

None.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Made alert system successful with admin portal live.

What we learned

Team Work. Collaboration.

What's next for Gramium

With technology, they will scale and reduce the defaulter events.

Child

Inspiration

All the NGO's present here are very inspiring as they striving hard to make someones life better. In particular Child as they strive hard to groom underprivileged children.

What it does

They provide holistic support for many needy childrens like medical, educational, skill development, nutrition support and vocational trainings.

They also support girl child for their holistic development and they try to create bonding beyond donation with love and care.

How we built it

We spoke extensively with the NGO to get their requirements right.
We prioritized them based on the importance We went with an approach of creating restful api's for the requirements We also created an android mobile app, so that they could go beyond desktop

Technology Used: server side : Node.js client side : bootstrap Database : MySql Mobile : Android

Challenges we ran into

  1. Getting the right requirements and prioritize them
  2. On deciding weather to do it from scratch or build on top of the existing frameworks
  3. Evaluated various frameworks like Joomla, Drupal and Word press
  4. Main challenge was deciding the contract between the front end and backend server
  5. Integration among the modules created a huge challenge

Accomplishments that we're proud of

  1. Understood the requirements right
  2. Having a working mobile app
  3. Implemented key requirements in web app

What we learned

  1. Team Work
  2. Better contract between the modules
  3. Leading the team in the all the phases
  4. Need to follow divide and conquer to break the requirements into tasks and complete them
  5. Confidence ## What's next for CHILD We still have things left, so would be in touch with CHILD and deliver their requirements .

BalVikas - A Surabi Initiative

Inspiration

During our discussions with the NGOs, we were able to realise the amount of selfless effort they are putting towards the upliftment of society. We as a team strongly believe that Children from all parts of the country should be able to receive education and we were immediately able to connect to the proposal of Surabi Trust.

What it does

The project comprises of 3 parts

  • Student Web App - Where the students can sign up on the platform and receive course recommendations, enroll for class, chat with mentors and complete assignments
  • Mentor App - Where the mentors enroll on the platform , create course curriculum, conduct online classes and review assignments
  • Administrator Web App - Where members of the surabi trust can review and approve members, activate/deactivate members and get a summary of the courses being conducted on the platform.

How we built it

  • We started off with a brainstorming session with the NGO to figure out the exact requirements, and how we can build features over the said requirements.
  • We then proceeded with the database design and Ui design in parallel to figure out the application flow.
  • Once the base flow has been done, we then build the api servers with the required end points using NodeJS
  • Then, we built the front end interface using Angular and ionic for the mobile and web interfaces
  • Finally, we tested out the end to end flow of the application to ensure that all major bugs are addressed before the final submission

Challenges we ran into

  • As part of the connect program, we wanted to have a P2P video calling facility to enable the mentor and the mentee have effective conversations. However, we discovered that the PayPal Guest wifi does not allow the connection to go through over port 9000. We quickly had to figure out why this was happening and if we can come up with a fix to solve this problem

Accomplishments that we're proud of

  • We are proud of the fact that every single member of the team was able to contribute to this project via Design, Coding and testing the complete application
  • We are also happy that we were able to come up with quick fixes for the problems that we haven't encountered before.
  • We also came up with a new logo for the project initiative within the project time frame itself.

What we learned

  • An effective team is crucial to the success of any project
  • Fail Fast and quickly re-iterate

What's next for BalVikas - A Surabi Initiative

  • We were able to complete only the web app and not the mobile app for the students on time although most of the screens have been completed. The next immediate task will be to complete this flow and roll it out as well.
  • Improve the overall architecture to ensure that the server can auto-scale with load
  • Work with the NGO to analyse the usage trends of the application and come up with more features that will help improve the usability of the application

Built With

  • angular.js
  • node.js
  • flask
  • ionic
  • mongodb

Try it out

  • github.com
I worked on the UI designs for the mentor app and also contributed towards testing the end to end workflow of the application.
V-excel inventory & task management

• NGO children with their trainers

  • Trainees performing tasks assigned to them

Inspiration

We were inspired by the opportunity to provide help for a noble cause. What can be more fruitful than enabling the children with special needs to earn their livelihood with dignity and self-respect.

What it does

The project built by us streamlines the operations and processes (inventory and task management; reporting; analysis) of the NGO's day to day activities. It will help in tracking and enhancing the efficiency of children with special needs. This includes providing them training, measuring their productivity in tasks assigned to them, and improving their overall well-being.

How we built it

We first had intense discussions with the key stakeholders (people from the NGO) to understand their requirements. We then proceeded towards designing and implementing an end to end solution from procurement of material to production and tracking the overall process.

Challenges we ran into

  1. Designing a generic and normalized database schema which mirrors the processes in different domains of their operations very closely.
  2. Further, we had very little time to implement a huge set of meaningful requirements.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

  1. Team work and synergy between the team
  2. We were able to design a solution which we think will be quite helpful to the NGO
  3. It gave us immense personal satisfaction to be a part such a noble cause.

What we learned

  1. Effective team work can get a lot done is a short span of time if they are motivated towards a cause.
  2. We learnt about breaking down the project into small manageable chunks and completing all those chunks within the time-span allotted to us.

What's next for V-excel inventory & task management

  1. We've committed to provide offline support to the NGO and to bring our endeavor to a meaningful end.
  2. Handing over the project as well the knowledge of maintaining the project to our NGO friends.

Inspiration

Social cause to support women empowerment

What it does

A mobile application on Android & iOS and Web Admin Page that will enable the 3 parties to communicate in an effective manner, where

Entrepreneur Referrer - Users who want add information about women entrepreneurs who want to use the Kiosks. Location Referrer - Users who want to suggest location of Kiosks for food distribution. Eco Admins (NGO) - Eco Admins who will have a web based interface to approve the locations and entrepreneurs. Also they can read the feedback entered by Kiosk users.

How We built it

Django, Python for Web Admin and API Native App in Android Native App in iOS

Challenges we ran into

1) UI Screens look and feel 2) Allow users to pick location from map 3) Integrating AI.ai (chat bots) 4) Developing django webservice for the first time for iOS and Android apps.

Accomplishments that we are proud of

We have got a full fledged Android, iOS app as requested by NGO's

What we learnt

Django UI Designs AI.ai chat bot Google Maps, MapView

What's next for Eco

Programme Management Platform for NGOs

A Web Platform to help empower women through skill development.

The platform admins can list various events for skill development under government and private initiatives and interested women candidates can enroll for the events. Every time a new event is added to the platform, the system notifies eligible registered women candidates about the events so that they can register to it.

The platform also sends reminder for events on the eve, uploads course complete certificates to system which can be downloaded by users from their profile page.

The platform also provides details about the NGO, Annai Educational Trust which is driving this wonderful initiative to empower women.

Some of the key features supported by the platform:

  1. User Registration and Login
  2. Add Events (Admin Functionality)
  3. Generate reports
  4. Notify users of upcoming events.
  5. Upload certificates of course completion (Admin functionality)
  6. Download certificates feature for women post course completion.
  7. Auto detect eligible candidates for events.
  8. Details about the NGO - Annai Educational Trust
  9. Trustees, Donation and Contact information of trust.

Application Tech Stack

Spring MVC, MongoDB, Java, HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript, Jquery, GIT, Tomcat

Note : We have a single component deployment model considering the maintainability aspect of it.
